column10: Base taken from lowest possible point of  Baculiltes compressus zone, top taken from base of overlying St. Mary River. Unit is time transgressive.

column7: Fowler, 2017
column10: Taken from base of D. Nebrascense to base of B. stevensoni. Approximate. Errors are guesses.

column7: Clinkscales and Lawton, 2015, Timing of Late Cretaceous shortening and basin development, Little Hatchet Mountains, southwestern New Mexico, USA - implications for regional Laramide tectonics
column10: Radiometric dates all report approx. 73 Ma. General info suggests somewhere between 70-75 Ma.

column7: Dean et al., 2019, Regional scale paleobathymetry controlled location, but not magnitude, of dynamics in the mid Campanian Western Interior Seaway, USA; Plink-Bjorklund, 2008, Wave-to-tide facies change in a Campanian shoreline complex, Chimney Rock Tongue, Wyoming-Utah, U.S.A.; Leary et al., 2015, Fluvial deposition during transition from flexural to dynamic subsidence in the Cordilleran foreland basin: Ericson Formation, Western Wyoming, USA
column10: Top well constrained by biostrat and radiometric dating  -  base less so.

column7: Metz, 2000, Upper Cretaceous (Campanian) sequence and biostratigraphy, west Texas to east central Utah; and development of cold-seep mounds in the Western Interior Cretaceous Basin
column10: Poorly constrained - appears to span entirety of Campanian at least.

column7: Pecha et al., 2018, Provenance of Cretaceous through Eocene strata of gthe Four Corners region: Insights from detreital zircons in the San Juan Basin, New Mexico and Colorado; Fowler, 2017; Lehman, 1985, Depositional environments of the Naashoibito Member of the Kirtland Shale, Upper Cretaceous, San Juan Basin, New Mexico; O'Shea, 2009, Volcanic influence over fluvial sedimentation in the Cretaceous McDermott Member, Animas Formation, Southwestern Colorado
column10: Information here all for McDermott Member - top part of formation extends to Eocene. Relatively controversial deposit - see Fowler (2017) for further details. Dates taken from detreital zircons mentioned in Pecha et al. 2018.

column7: Roberts, 1972, Cretaceous and early Tertiary depositional and tectonic history of the Livingston area, southwestern Montana; Horner, 1989, The Mesozoic terrestrial ecosystems of Montana
column10: Little information available; mudstone in upper third of formation yielded palynomorph assemablge equivalent to Colgate Member of Fox Hills. Top reported as latest Maastrichtian. Roberts (1972) suggested approx. 70-66 Ma - have gone with this asessment.

column7: Kluth and Nelson, 1988, Age of the Dawson Arkose, Southwestern Air Force Acaemy, Colorado, and implications for the uplift history of the Front Range; Marvin and Dobson, 1979, U.S. Geological Survey radiometric ages; Compilation "B": Isochron/West
column10: Lower limit based on Palynology - late Maastrichtian, comparable to Hell Creek Flora. Upper limited based on radiometric date from tuffs.

column7: Wick and Lehman, 2011, A new ceratopsian dinosaur from the Javelina Formation (Maastrichtian) of West Texas and implications for chasmosaurine phylogeny
column10: Poorly constrained , but apparently co-eval to Javelina formation

column7: Fowler, 2017
column10: Dates taken from Fowler (2017); see relevant section for full discussion

column7: Harris et al., 1996, Four-toed theropod footprints and a paleomagnetic age from the Whetstone Falls Member of the Harebell Formation (Upper Cretaceous : Maastrichtian) , northwestern Wyoming
column10: Well constrained at both base and top, but error bars not given - approximated

column7: Serrano-Branas et al., 2006, A new ornithomimid dinosaur from the Upper Cretaceous Packard Shale formation (Cabullona Group) Sonora, Mexico; Gonzalez-Leon et al, 2017, Stratigraphy, geochronology and regional tectonic setting of the Late Cretaceous (ca. 82-70 Ma) Cabullona basin, Sonora, Mexico
column10: Gradational boundary into Packard below - part of formation is dated at type section as ~72/72.5 Ma. Basin has a minimum ageg of 70 Ma - as the top formation of the group, age must cap around this point.

column7: Pecha et al., 2018, Provenance of Cretaceous through Eocene strata of gthe Four Corners region: Insights from detreital zircons in the San Juan Basin, New Mexico and Colorado; Fowler, 2017; Lehman, 1985, Depositional environments of the Naashoibito Member of the Kirtland Shale, Upper Cretaceous, San Juan Basin, New Mexico; O'Shea, 2009, Volcanic influence over fluvial sedimentation in the Cretaceous McDermott Member, Animas Formation, Southwestern Colorado
column10: Relatively controversial deposit - see Fowler (2017) for further details. Dates taken from detreital zircons mentioned in Pecha et al. 2018. Same as Animas.

column7: Watkins and Self-Trail, 2005; Calcareous nannofossil evidence for the existence of the Gulf Stream during the late Maastrichtian; Ciampaglio and Weaver, 2007, MAASTRICHTIAN (CRETACEOUS) REGULAR ECHINOIDS FROM THE ROCKEY POINT MEMBER, PEEDEE FORMATION SOUTHEASTERN NORTH CAROLINA
column10: Disagreements on positioning of Peedee within Maastrichtian. Suggestions of late Early-Mid, Mid-Late and Late - here have gone with most recent analysis from cores, which places towards end of Maastrichtrian.
